subject: p16662264
History: -year-old female patient status post bronchoscopy. Bronchial aspiration biopsies in right upper lobe, right middle lobe, transbronchial biopsy of right middle lobe nodule, evaluate for possible pneumothorax.
Findings: AP single view of the chest has been obtained with patient in sitting semi-upright position. Comparison is made with the next preceding PA and lateral chest examination of. Comparison of the frontal views demonstrates increase of pulmonary parenchymal densities in the area of the biopsies, most likely caused by post-biopsy hemorrhages. No other new pulmonary abnormalities are seen, and most importantly, there is no evidence of any pneumothorax on this single view chest examination.
